com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.lineWrapping

Interface LineWrapped

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultiLineWrapped, WrappedCell, ScaledImage.WrappedImage, Table.WrappedTable, Text.WrappedText, LineWrapped.ZeroLineWrapped

    public LineWrapped

    Represents a fixed-size item. Classes implementing this interface should be immutable.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  LineWrapped.DefaultImpls
      Represents a fixed-size item. Classes implementing this interface should be immutable.
      static class  LineWrapped.ZeroLineWrapped 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getAscent()
      Height above the baseline of this line
      Dim getDim()
      These are the dim without/before page-breaking adjustments.
      float getLineHeight()
      Total vertical height this line, both above and below the baseline
      Dim render(RenderTarget lp, Coord topLeft, boolean reallyRender)
      Sends the underlying object to PDFBox to be drawn.
      Dim render(RenderTarget lp, Coord topLeft)
      Sends the underlying object to PDFBox to be drawn. Use the other render() method with reallyRender=false for an exact measurement after page breaking without actually drawing anything.

    • Method Detail

      • getDim

        Dim getDim()

        These are the dim without/before page-breaking adjustments.

      • getAscent

        float getAscent()

        Height above the baseline of this line

      • getLineHeight

        float getLineHeight()

        Total vertical height this line, both above and below the baseline

      • render

        Dim render(RenderTarget lp,
           Coord topLeft,
           boolean reallyRender)

        Sends the underlying object to PDFBox to be drawn.

        Parameters:
        lp - RenderTarget is the SinglePage or PageGrouping to draw to. This will contain the paper size, orientation, and body area which are necessary in order to calculate page breaking
        topLeft - is the offset where this item starts.
        reallyRender - render if true. Otherwise, just measure without drawing anything. This may be a little awkward for the end-user, but it lets us use exactly the same logic for measuring as for drawing which prevents bugs and there's a version of this method without this parameter.
        Returns:
        the adjusted Dim which may include extra (vertical) spacing required to nudge some items onto the next page so they don't end up in the margin or off the page.

      • render

        Dim render(RenderTarget lp,
           Coord topLeft)

        Sends the underlying object to PDFBox to be drawn. Use the other render() method with reallyRender=false for an exact measurement after page breaking without actually drawing anything.

        Parameters:
        lp - RenderTarget is the SinglePage or PageGrouping to draw to. This will contain the paper size, orientation, and body area which are necessary in order to calculate page breaking
        topLeft - is the offset where this item starts.
        Returns:
        the adjusted Dim which may include extra (vertical) spacing required to nudge some items onto the next page so they don't end up in the margin or off the page.
